column2: NEW MEXICO PERMIT TEST
column6: NM

column2: Question Text
column6: Answer2 Text

column2: 1. Who has a greater risk of being involved in a traffic crash?
column6: Drivers who are driving alone.

column2: 2. In heavy rain, tires can begin to ride on the water that is on top of the road pavement. This is called:
column6: rideplaning.

column2: 3. On slippery roads, drivers should:
column6: increase their speed to avoid hydroplaning.

column2: 4. What does a red arrow on a traffic light mean?
column4: You must stop. Do not go in the direction of the arrow until a green light or arrow light goes on.
column6: You may proceed slowly through the intersection.
column8: You must stop and then proceed when the way is clear.
column10: You may turn in the direction of the arrow.

column2: 5. You go with a group of friends to a social event, and you plan to have a few drinks. You should:
column4: make alcohol the focus of the event.
column6: avoid alternating between drinks with alcohol and drinks without any alcohol.
column8: stop drinking several minutes before you intend to leave.
column10: arrange to ride home with a friend who does not drink.

column2: 6. When following a motorcycle, drivers do not need to allow as much distance as when following a car.
column6: False

column2: 7. If another vehicle passes you on the left, you must:
column4: decrease your speed slightly and keep to the right.
column6: increase your speed slightly and keep to the right.
column8: decrease your speed, then pull over to the right and stop.
column10: increase your speed and move to the left.

column2: 8. Drivers may pass another vehicle if the line dividing two lanes is a ________ line.
column6: solid yellow

column2: 9. Drivers under 21 years of age are considered to be driving under the influence if their blood alcohol concentration (BAC) is:
column6: .10% or higher.

column2: 10. You can pass on the right:
column4: when passing is restricted by parked cars.
column6: when a vehicle that is approaching from the opposite direction is prepared to turn left.
column8: when a vehicle ahead makes a right turn.
column10: when a vehicle ahead makes a left turn.

column2: 11. A yellow arrow used to control turns from a specific traffic lane:
column4: is warning the traffic a green arrow is about to be shown.
column6: is never used as a traffic signal.
column8: means that you may go in the direction indicated by the arrow.
column10: means the same as a circular yellow light for the lane of traffic indicated by the arrow.

column2: 12. When you reach an intersection with a stop sign, you should:
column4: follow the vehicle ahead of you.
column6: check your rearview mirror, look left, then right, then proceed.
column8: stop, look right, then left, then right again.
column10: stop, look left, then right, then left again.

column2: 13. When driving through a construction zone, drivers should:
column6: come to a complete stop and watch for a flagger.

column2: 14. This road sign means:
column6: Hill or downgrade up ahead

column2: 15. To avoid glare from headlights of an approaching car:
column6: don't look directly into the oncoming headlights, look toward the right edge of your lane.
column8: stay focused on the center line on the road.

column2: 16. Driving under the influence of any medication which impairs your driving ability is permitted:
column6: if it is prescribed by a physician.

column2: 17. This road sign means:
column6: Yield

column2: 18. When driving in bad weather, drivers should:
column6: increase their speed to get to their destination more quickly.

column2: 19. When you enter a freeway exit ramp:
column4: slow down before entering the exit ramp.
column6: don’t slow down on the freeway itself. Wait until you are in the deceleration lane.
column8: maintain your speed once in the exit ramp.
column10: pass slower vehicles on the right.

column2: 20. ___________ are the most frequent fatality in work zone crashes.
column6: Motorcyclists

column2: 21. This road sign means:
column6: No Passing Zone

column2: 22. Regulation signs normally are:
column6: green rectangles.

column2: 23. A vehicle that enters a road from a driveway:
column4: must yield to traffic approaching from the right, while it has the right-of-way over vehicles approaching from the left.
column6: must stop and yield the right-of-way to traffic on the roadway and to pedestrians.

column2: 24. Drivers can not pass a vehicle on the left if:
column4: they can not safely return to the right lane before they reach a solid yellow center line for the right lane.
column6: they are within 100 feet of a railroad crossing on a two-way roadway.
column8: they approach the top of a hill on a two-way road and can not see over it.

column2: 25. This sign indicates:
column6: Merging traffic
